snippet: President Obama suggested Tuesday night that it was time to close out the politics of austerity and move to a more balanced approach on fiscal issues.
abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama's State of the Union address lays out a broad argument for the role of government in fostering economic recovery and securing the middle class; represents shift away from emphasis on shrinking government that has dominated political discourse for several years.
lead_paragraph: President Obama suggested Tuesday night that it was time to close out the politics of austerity and move to a more balanced approach on fiscal issues.

headline.print_headline: In an Age of Spending Cuts, Making the Case for Government
headline.seo: Obama Makes Case for Government in State of Union Address
headline.main: In Age of Spending Cuts, Making a Case for Government
